abstract: Political Memo; presidential hopefuls Hillary Rodham Clinton and Jeb Bush both find themselves grappling with growing demands from activists within their parties; campaign stops put both contenders face to face with voters expressing deep disappointment with stale political leadership and what they view as systemic problems in American society.
lead_paragraph: Presidential candidates are struggling with the demands of activists who see the hopefuls falling short on concrete plans to address issues like race, poverty and immigration.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.main: Candidates Caught in Middle as Words Ring Hollow to Activists
headline.print_headline: Candidates Caught in Middle as Words Ring Hollow to Activists

snippet: Presidential candidates are struggling with the demands of activists who see the hopefuls falling short on concrete plans to address issues like race, poverty and immigration....
